website_summaries.verdict: USB-C adapter hub that is sure to have the port you need for almost any kind of data or power transfer.
pros: Gives you eight different ports, including three USB 3.0 ports, an Ethernet port, a 4K HDMI port, a USB-C power port, an SD memory card slot, and a micro-SD card slot
Available in three different metallic colors that match Apple products
Take it with you anywhere, thanks to its small size
cons: Using the power port may cause some error messages to appear
Tends to run hot to the touch

customer_reviews.title: Adapter Overheats
customer_reviews.text: I have had this adapter for about a year now. Over the last several months, it has begun overheating drastically. At first, it was just causing issues with the ethernet connection so that my macbook did not recognize it. Then it started causing my keyboard which is connected via usb to be disabled because of too much power being generated. Currently I have to disconnect the adapter every so often to bring the temperature down in order even make it usable. I will be replacing this product immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Brislin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, for a week!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mostly to be used for a network adapter and also the added benefit being a standard USB hub. It worked fantastic for about a week but suddenly the network adapter stopped working altogether. I work in IT and am therefore not new to fixing issues. Everything else on the hub still works but since it no longer works for its intended purpose I’m pretty disappointed. UPDATE Seller was very nice about the issue and offered replacement or full refund almost immediately. I chose to get a refund as I already purchased the Apple official USB-C Gig ethernet adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product UNLESS you need the Ethernet port
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular hub primarily because it included the Ethernet port. Unfortunately, unless you run power to this hub, the Ethernet port does not work (confirmed by the seller.) (And if you do run power to this hub to make the Ethernet work ... then your 15" MacBook will go dead because there's not enough juice left to charge it, as many other reviews have said and the manufacturer agrees with.) So basically I'd need to spend another $50 minimum (third-party) to get a charger just to power this hub to make the Ethernet port work. No thanks. Great, quick response from seller, and outside of the charging/power limitations, it seems top-notch = 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Harvey

customer_reviews.title: This is a good hub that failed after less than 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hub occasionally for the last year and a half. It worked reasonably well and as described, but it did run extremely hot. I regularly unplugged it to cool it down because it ran too hot to feel comfortable. After about 18 months it has started to fail, and it regularly cuts out. There is a momentary disconnection of all devices throughout the day. I do wonder if this was a faulty device out of the box as it ran very hot. Unfortunately, it is out of warranty, and I will need to buy a different hub.
customer_reviews.author: rrh

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this hub daily for about 6 months now. No hiccups, no problems. Seems to be made of high quality materials and has turned out to be very reliable. I'm using every single port on it, too. EDIT: After 9 months, the HDMI port started flaking out. It will disconnect randomly after the unit heats up. Downgraded from 5 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: product quality questionable
customer_reviews.text: the base plug that connects the "unit' to the wire that goes into the MacBook pro port, is cheap, and when moved in the slightest way causes file transfer/connectivity error. If not moved at all, it works. Therefore, how could this be possible for successful connection/functionality. I loved the product until this quality chord issue popped up. Questionable materials/design of this chord.
customer_reviews.author: slojotaa

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: This was trash. Stopped working within one week. It kept popping up an error that it was drawing too much power so I put it aside for a month or so (after 30 day return period) afterwards I tried using a usb item that had its own power supply and it still prompted that error message. I tried several other items and same thing. I had to buy a different item. I messaged Sinstar about it and they promised a refund... over 30 says later... nothing. I emailed again and they said that they forgot because a holiday or something and that they would refund right away.... again.... nothing. They never did anything about... will never purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: gr8iphones

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have contacted the seller about the heat this product produces. They state it can reach up to 150F but that it will not damage the unit. They also stated they are looking into the heating temps to get it lowered. So, I am updating my original review due to their immediate response on my issue. This adapter is very well made, high quality in the unit itself as well as the cord and usb-c plug.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Got a defective unit but the seller stands by guarantee.
customer_reviews.text: Update: seller contacted me and offered a refund. Sometimes devices are defective but the seller stands behind the guarantee. Can't give it 5 stars but its all worked out in the end. Can't use ethernet at the same time as HDMI. If you do, the ethernet port will randomly turn itself off every couple minutes. Unit runs very hot so maybe its overheating? Ethernet port works fine if I'm not using HDMI output at the same time. I can use a USB/ethernet adapter plugged into the unit (also a realtek) and that works fine as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lorgan

customer_reviews.title: All In One Device
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad a friend recommended this product to me. I have a camera that uses a SD card. The off-brand go-pro uses a microSD card. I’ve always had to attach both cards to this usb reader and then attach that reader to the laptop. I guess with frequent use, the USB reader would sometime corrupt the files. With this USB C HUB, it saves me the trouble of having to find extra gadgets to serve as the middleman. So happy I purchased it bc it’s an all-in-one device!
customer_reviews.author: HN

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found - Look at all the others then buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I've bought others for my MacBook Pro, This is the best -period. Look at the reviews on the $250-350 docks and they all talk about the screen flickering and going out - I've experienced the same issue with others but not with this one. This dock has 4k screen -very important if you even have a mid-line screen and its all in one -perfect setup. I contacted apple to verify all these connections(power, cat 5 cable, usb, hdmi) can go thru one usb-c port and the tech advised no problem -He is right, it works great. Buy it you won't regret it
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Adapter works as advertised for Macbook 12" with 4k 30 Hz monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for my Macbook 12" 2016. Pass through power works well, HDMI 4k 30 Hz is a breeze, and 3 USB ports. Only minor concern: My laptop does charge more slowly through this adapter than when plugged directly into the computer. The Macbook only draws 29W, so I can't say how well pass through power would work for higher wattage charging with the new Macbook Pros, but they have more USB-c ports anyhow, so pass through power isn't essential.
customer_reviews.author: Neural Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Good but power issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for its Ethernet port. It works fine (though occasionally I needed to restart the MacBook). Well constructed and looks nice. Charging of my iPhone is slow however - at least 4 or 5 hours. Additionally, connecting an external hard drive via UBS Type C didn't work (though the hard drive worked fine when connected directly to the MacBook) - I suspect it is because not enough power is being delivered via the Type C.
customer_reviews.author: Bo S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to a MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: With a lot of older peripherals and a new laptop featuring USB-C connections, this hub was an excellent way to bridge the connectivity gap. As I have my laptop on a small stand, I also bought a 1-foot Spigen male to male USB-C extender so the hub would sit nicely on the desk. It's all good now, though I wish the cable of the hub was a bit longer so as not to have needed an extender. A small thing that may not matter to most.
customer_reviews.author: R. Oswald

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: Actually one year and 10 days after purchase. The connection cable has a short in it and now has stopped sending the signal. $70 per year to connect my mouse to my computer? Although this is a solution to a terrible design decision from Apple to do away with all ports aside from USB C (separate issue) I would like to think that a product like this, which is made to connect to a portable device (laptop) would be a little more robust. Going into the e-waste garbage today :-(
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: USB Ports for External Keyboard & Mouse are Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great on this adapter except for one thing. When I plug in a USB-A adapter in for an external keyboard and mouse, the adapter occasionally has problems recognizing the keyboard and mouse. I will type on the external keyboard or move the external mouse and get no response, or if I get one it takes a while. Have confirmed that it's not the keyboard because it happens with multiple keyboards. Also, have confirmed that it's the adapter because a different USB-A to USB-C adapter I have does work with my external keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Ostler

customer_reviews.title: This product is the one, one out of many many dongles that all claim to work.
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to find a good dongle and this one was the best for me. you may be looking at this and ask, can I trust this person, Yes you CAN! believe it this works. Only downside is that the micro sd card slot is faulty but you could still use the adapter and put it in the regular card slot. I just downloaded movies on a seagate, transferred photos from one camera sd card to a photo backup drive and this dongle performed perfectly. It did not get too hot, it wasn't glitchy, and it securely sat there in the usb port. In case your wondering, the space grey matches perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Palmesano

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase for anyone on the go or at home
customer_reviews.text: I use this hub daily and it works great for my everyday needs for power and an HDMI output for a second display. I've used it on dozens of displays including monitors and projectors when speaking at conferences. Also great to have USB-A ports and the SD slots for photography. And when I've actually got an ethernet cord to plug into, it's perfect. This thing is small, rugged, and works very well. One of the only reviews I've done on Amazon; it's worth the time to review it because they deserve the positive review.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias Paddles

customer_reviews.title: It works fine, but gets very hot
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, but gets very hot, and cannot pass through the usb-c charger to power a MacBook Pro. If you can spare a usb-c port for charging and just need a decent usb hub with ethernet, this will work for you. Have not tried the card reader.
customer_reviews.author: E Rothman

customer_reviews.title: Portable, high-functionality, stylish; excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Comes with 3 USB, sd card slot, HDMI AND power plus for MacBook --this is key: some adapters don't have a power wire plugin, meaning you have to use your only other usb-c port for power (fI have a 2016 MacBook pro) -Small, durable (excellent for students or business people traveling with laptop/accessories) -Stylish! Honestly, Apple should make this type of adaptor (or acquire this business) Cons: -The ports can be a bit of a tight squeeze, but that's about it (and I'm being picky here) -In the future, consider packaging it with a storage bag/pouch! Bottom line: if you are a for a medium-duty, stylish, affordable USB-c adapter, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Gagan

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a new MacBookPro!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, solve my "dongle hell" with one unit. Works perfectly (ethernet, firewire, SD card reader, etc.). Trust me, if you have a new MacBookPro on order or just purchased, do yourself a huge favor and BUY ONE of these! It made transferring files from my old MacBook easy and I just don't know what I'd without this. Excellent product, nicely done. ps the color matches the space gray exactly too.
customer_reviews.author: pilotSteve

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of this item. One silver for my Macbook Pro silver and one space grey for my second Macbook Pro. Durable and made of aluminum metal that matches the Macbook. We made a mistake of purchasing one that extends like the Macbook body with 2 USB-C sticking out. We were in Chennai, India doing a project for audio/video. The USB-C hub we bought kept disconnecting our A/V hardware during critical sessions. This one does the trick. Flexible and would not lose connection. I wish we brought this to India instead. Finding the right hardware overseas was a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Kolohe J

customer_reviews.title: I use the Sinstar 8 in 1 Aluminum Multi Port Adapter everyday
customer_reviews.text: I have all ports except one of the USB 3.0 ports in use and I have no noticeable problems with data transfer, printing or internet connection. I use an extra monitor with my MacBook Air 2018 and a scanner as well as a solid state external drive, power cord and my iphone connected as well. The only time it got hot was when I tried attaching a battery to charge while using all the ports. It got really hot. Other than that it works great everyday. Zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: DesertDog

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hub for MBP
customer_reviews.text: Edit- their customer service was lovely but both the original purchased and the replacement stopped working (the replacement stopped quickly). Network connectivity because unreliable and pass through would get hot enough to where I'd stop using it. I replaced this with a hoo-too adapter that's much better. Love this hub! Works exactly as advertised and customer support was very helpful in promptly answering all my questions. It’s been a huge asset in plugging in all my externals- monitor, hard drive, Ethernet and Even my SD card. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: severe noise with Dell Monitor through HDMI
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a year on my Mac book. It worked well and it started having trouble with Dell Monitor through HDMI. Monitor is extremely noisy and eventually I cannot use it. It seems connection has an issue and I have switched to "ENKLEN USB C Hub" product and everything works beautifully. What is proves is the severe noise in the Dell Monitor through HDMI is not from either cable or monitor, Macbook but, solely this product. I tried to return and get new one considering sample-to-sample variation but, return is not allowed. Very disappointing to see this low reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Goldie Song

customer_reviews.title: A great choice for expanding your USB-C port
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Simple to use - Plenty of the ports you'll need/want - Works for Mac OS and for Windows 10 Cons: - First time plugged in to my Surface Go it did not load all the drivers correctly and displayed an error. Fixed by unplugging the Sinstar device and then plugging it back in. Overall, I would recommend this product if you are looking to expand your USB-C port.
customer_reviews.author: Dale N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for phone (LG V20) and laptop (Dell)
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time with usb-c and I was amazed. Plug the hub to the phone , connected network cable , HDMI and SD card. I can play 4k movies from network server and videos and music from SD card. At the same time I can plug in charger to the hub and keep juice going to the phone. This is amazing. Portable HD player.
customer_reviews.author: mic_pio

customer_reviews.title: Network port allows unconnected plug
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for network at my desk and was thinking my cable had a problem staying plugged in, so I finally got another cable. It turns out the port on this device does not hold the plug fully connected! Any movement of the laptop or cable and it slides out just enough to no longer be connected. Even though the cable is still inside the port, it no longer is in contact internally. I'm now going to be looking for something else. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DJ C.

customer_reviews.title: Good option for the portless MacBook Pros
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an option to continue using my new Macbook Pro for all of the tasks I needed as a high school teacher. However with zero USB ports, SD slots, headphone jacks, etc. I was expecting to have some bumps in the transition. This hub allowed me to pick up on day 1 of my new computer just as always - I was able to connect to my classroom monitor, upload videos from a camera, and hardwire audio just like always. I've used it for a few months with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: EBH

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this hub for a couple of months. It worked fine for sometime, but now devices inserted, monitor, external hard drive, keyboard, etc, get disconnected with minor movement to the hub. It's very annoying when external hard driver gets improperly ejected during transfer because I moved the hub out the way of cables or the attached monitor shuts down because it gets disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: Orat

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but definitely needs improvement...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little item after I realized that my new MacBook 12 inch came with only one USC hub and I required to plug in several things to it! (My bad - didn't do my homework completely). This has helped tremendously so I can have all my items readily connected to my laptop. Few things I would improve: the length of the connecting cable to the laptop (maybe a few inches longer?) and over-heating issues that affect LAN cable connectivity (it stops connecting me to the internet when it gets hot for some reason).
customer_reviews.author: Akimi Fukaura

customer_reviews.title: i would say that i love it. It's light
customer_reviews.text: i would say that i love it. It's light, simple, works, it charges my MBP 13" while connecting my ultrawide screen with no issues. basically it's perfect. the only downside, it's yes, it gets hot, not sure if in the long term this will mean burn and die... but for the past 2 weeks it has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Product
customer_reviews.text: When I bought my new MacBook Pro I was disappointed that there were no ports for any of my storage devices, especially my Flash Drives, which I use for storing files so that I can free my computer up. With the USB C Hub, Sinstar 8 in 1 Aluminum Multi Port Adapter Type C Combo Hub for MacBook Pro I am able to charge my phone and access multiple flash drives at the same time! It's a relief to know that I can access multiple storage devices at the same time. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Matkabob

customer_reviews.title: Works with MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is a really handy hub that works well with my MacBook. Just plugged it in, and it worked. I haven’t had a chance to evaluate the performance quantifiably but I do have it hooked up to two external drives, one of which is my time machine backup, and am using the Ethernet port and have not noticed any issues. I am actually thinking about buying another one to keep In my travel kit
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Rider

customer_reviews.title: Failed on me
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of hopes for this device, worked out really well for first 9 months or so, now its DOA. Started noticing my USB devices were turning on and off - going flaky on me...thought it was the USB cables, turns out its the dang hub and it kept getting worse over time and now its totally dead. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: pes

customer_reviews.title: The SD card reader did not work
customer_reviews.text: Update: the seller contacted me and is sending out another device. I will leave as 5 stars unless I have a problem with the new one. I love the device and hope the new one works! If you press and hold the SD card in it works but it does not lock into place like it should. You also have to put it in upside down which is a little strange. On the plus side this hub did not shut down my wifi like the last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Davis

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great and is a good value for all the functionality ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for about a year. I've used the USB ports, ethernet, SD card slot and also plugged a charger into the USB C to charge my laptop. This thing works great and is a good value for all the functionality provided, since Apple has basically removed everything useful. My usage has been with a 2016 Macbook Pro 13 and I don't have any problems to report.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stephens

customer_reviews.title: * All other slots worked fine without incident
customer_reviews.text: * I think the product runs too hot to the touch. And, could be the reason for the HDMI failure. I did try different HDMI cables, and the problem still existed. * The micro-SD slot design is iffy. I put one in it and it got stuck. And, I did put it in the right way. I decided not using it and use the SD slot. * All other slots worked fine without incident. I contacted Sinstar about my HDMI port and they were very quick to resolve and are sending me a new one. The received a 4 star because of the HDMI port, but I'm very happy they will replace it without hassling me.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Fox

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hub to extend the USB C connections on my 15" Macbook Pro (2018 model). It has a decent build, although it would help if the USB-C connector cable that comes out of the hub would be a little longer. Out of the box, the HDMI output did not work and there was no video output to my external monitor. Within a week of use, the hub has stopped delivering power to my laptop... rendering it completely useless. I would NOT recommend anyone to buy this product. I would give it 0 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: If you have a MBP with usb c ports... just buy it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best accessory to buy for your MBP, 4 USB ports... check, SD card reader... check, Ethernet port.... check. You can even plug in your charger cable into it so that you don't lose another port on your mbp. Definitely recommend it for people who have usb c MBPs. I use it mostly when transferring pictures from my fuji xt2 and sony a7III. I haven't had any problems with the speed or it reading the SD cards.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far but runs very hot
customer_reviews.text: A few days in and so far the device works just fine! I have not tested for speed of the device but haven't noticed any obvious issues. I am concerned long term with how hot the device is and can it sustain without parts failing. I am using 2 USB ports for a mouse and speaker, have a charging cable plugged in and the Ethernet connection. I have not tested the micro-SD nor HDMI yet. Overall happy with it but will hold final judgement until I use it a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: John Liang

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a lot of trouble from other 3rd party usbc hubs on my work Mac book pro. The others seems to be loose in the socket causing them to lose connections to the monitor and usb keyboard almost randomly. The usbc adapter on this item is very snug and there have been no problems to report to date. I’d be interested in seeing how the cable between the Mac and the adapter holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. X

customer_reviews.title: A great little all-in-one adapter!
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT supporting a fleet of several hundred Apple computers and have had to test a bunch of different USB-C adapters to support the new USB-C-only MacBooks. So far, this one has provided the most positive feedback from our users and we're really happy with it. Build quality is great and everything works as expected with no additional setup required. Will definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great all-in-one adapter for their Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bulmer

customer_reviews.title: Overheats frequently and then fails to connect power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with my MacBook Pro, and I'm disappointed. At first glance, the hub lives up to all of its claims, but when I use it as a cabled ethernet adapter and power relay, it overheats after a couple of hours, and at that point it effectively disconnects the power from the MacBook, but continues to *draw* power from the battery. So if that happens overnight, the battery is dead by morning. So overall, good for short-term use (up to a couple hours), but not for all-day use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in suburban Boston

customer_reviews.title: My son bought one. So did I...
customer_reviews.text: My adult son has been using one for several months with good success. I also bought one and have found it to be quite useful. I do real estate photography and I appreciate that it has card readers for both ST and microSD cards. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: not great, the card slots seemed messed up
customer_reviews.text: not great, the card slots seemed messed up. the card seemed to want to go in too far like it would get stuck in there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The USB ports are not powered so you cannot use remote storage like a WD passport storage drive
customer_reviews.text: OK, followup. Manufacturer offered me full refund as I cannot have a new one shipped to me here in Africa. So. Good guys...This was old review: The cord from the hub to the pc is to short (all products on the market have this problem so purchase an extension cable) . The USB ports are not powered so you cannot use remote storage like a WD passport storage drive. The other ports continue to work ok. Driving big monitor and Lan connection which are working well.
customer_reviews.author: Torrey Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good Product if it works.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this adapter for a while and it has worked great but in recent times I have had some major issues. It won't stop disconnecting, when in use. If I plug in anything to the hub and say pick up my laptop the hub disconnects software side. IT is physically plugged in still but just randomly disconnects unless I hold it perfectly still. Very annoying when trying to use external displays with the HDMI port.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great follow-up service. to address a defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sinstar 8 in 1 hub to provide connectivity for a new MacBook Pro. Unfortunately, all functions except the Ethernet connection and the card readers stopped working after about 3 weeks of normal use. Despite the 30-day return policy, the seller has promised to send a replacement at no cost, and explains that the unit has a lifetime warranty. This has been a good customer service experience so far. I will post an additional review once I've received a replacement hub and used it for a period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis P. Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!
customer_reviews.text: So far this product works great. I had a Dell adaptor for my Dell XPS and it was a piece of junk. It was very temperamental and always disconnected the internet. This product has more adapters and has been working fine. Good customer service, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything works seamlessly on new Macbook 2018 Air.
customer_reviews.text: High quality construction, aluminum case conducts heat, HDMI works well as do the three USB ports and SD slot. I run an external screen and logitech wireless keyboard and mouse - I attach the unifying receiver to a USB extension cable so that it is not sitting behind the Sinstar hub directly - I found that the aluminum case tends to block the bluetooth signal. I also put the Sinstar on a metal trivet to act as a heat sink to help keep it cool. Device does run warm when laptop is active but is cool when laptop is put to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: David Tsiang

customer_reviews.title: This hub is really great. The only issue I have had after 1 ...
customer_reviews.text: This hub is really great. The only issue I have had after 1 month of ownership, is that it can't run my external Blu-ray player and power an external HD at the same time. I guess the Blu-ray is a power hog. I purchased this hub thinking it would be the only adaptor I would ever need for my new MacBook Pro, but I've found myself purchasing and using dedicated USB C cables for my devices instead. Using the Hub as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This is not high-speed.
customer_reviews.text: If this USB-C hub was high speed, then the ethernet port on this hub would be, at minimum, 1 gigabit. With USB-C being able to carry 10 ~ 20 Gbps, there's no reason to have a 100 Mbit ethernet adapter. This is where this device's $60 price tag is not worth its value...
customer_reviews.author: thatinstant

customer_reviews.title: Hot, hot, hot! And I don't mean hot as in good, I mean hot as in temperature...
customer_reviews.text: If this thing got any hotter, I could cook an egg on it. I'm literally afraid to run power through it. And all I have is HDMI and a mouse USB connection. I bought it to be a single connection for my MacBook, and it's turned into a 75% solution.
customer_reviews.author: R. Arden

customer_reviews.title: The product works fine; price is high for what it is
customer_reviews.text: The adaptor is just that, an adaptor. The ports all work fine; it's light and goes well with my current Macbook in terms of appearance. It just seems silly to pay nearly $100 for something like this but what can you do when Apple controls our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product... When it Worked
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in June for my new laptop. Loved the expansion it offered me. End of October started to notice transfer speeds slowing down. November I noticed I had to hold the adapter in a certain position for SD data to transfer. HDMI port now constantly cuts out, no more Netflix from my laptop to my TV. I am sure it will be like this will all of these adapters that have the 6 inch cable connecting them to the computer. Eventually they just wear out, but the life of this one was way too short.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Rasner

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge Zenbook 3.
customer_reviews.text: Will not pass through charge my Zenbook 3 I have tried everything. Description says Zenbook 3 compatible. Revised: The manufacturer contacted me me and tried to rectify the situation, but they discovered that its not compatible with Zenbook 3. They have revised their compatibility list. I'm adding 2 stars because they tried.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with 4TB WD Passport and HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised for at least the USB ports and hdmi (all I've used so far)! USBs support power to 4tb WD Passport without connection/power loss. Quality/light metal piece and the sockets fit the components nice and snug. I love that there is a lifetime warranty to fall back on if ever needed which I was reminded about in an email 2 weeks after receiving the product. Polite customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 4 months (occasional use) ... then started stuttering
customer_reviews.text: I was OK with this purchase - the device would heat up more than I liked when I had it plugged in to power, but it read cards and output video fine. But just today my macbook started disconnecting/reconnecting/disconnecting to power every 5 seconds. The HDMI and USB hub still work if I unplug from power... but that's just something that will have to tide me over until I buy a better quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Verl Barlow

customer_reviews.title: it will slow your external SSD drive down by about 20%
customer_reviews.text: I liked this, it works great and all, and it works with my network on the local LAN here. Hooks up nice with USB 3 with three ports. I already had an HDMI cable adapter for USB-C so I didn't need the HDMI port, but the SD card ports work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reliable performance, especially for monitor
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reliable performance, especially for monitor (many other adapters flicker). The only thing is that I can't get ethernet to work (it detects the connection but I can't get an IP address; so I plugged Ethernet via a USB-A adapter into the hub which works). And all USB-A ports, power, and HDMI monitor work great so I'm set.
customer_reviews.author: AN734

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro: Ethernet failed.
customer_reviews.text: Used this with my 2017 MacBook Pro 15". This worked for about 2 months, then the Ethernet port stopped working. It always ran warm, then stopped. Disappointing. ============================================================================================== Update: worked with the mfg and their customer support team. Their team was very responsive and helpful. They were able to correct the issue. Excellent marks on customer service!
customer_reviews.author: RW Howell

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to transfer data from my old MacBook to my new MacBook Pro. It worked like a champ. Now it is my main access for older USB devices and the HDMI connector for my monitor. I would definitely buy it again if I needed one. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Howe

customer_reviews.title: A nice unit
customer_reviews.text: On a new MacBook Pro couldn't get more than 1080p even if I went down to 24Hz display refresh. UPDATE: It appears this is a limitation of my monitor. It can only do 1080p through HDMI even though it can do 1440p through DisplayPort. A hub like this with DisplayPort would be nice!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ashley Stevens

customer_reviews.title: A single device allows you to attach to HDMI HD display, Ethernet port, and numerous USB devices!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this hub. A single device allows you to attach to HDMI HD display, Ethernet port, and numerous USB devices! PLUS I can charge my MacBook Pro all at the same time! It has been working great for a couple of months now.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: One of the best out there. The design is very sleek and smart. The connection speed is very adequate. I would highly recommend this product for anyone needing a hub.
customer_reviews.author: The C

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have it for about a week now and it works as expected, without any issues at all. I have tried all 3 USB 3.0 ports, the Ethernet and the USB-C port for charging and they all work perfectly. Haven't tried the HDMI or the card readers yet. The hub itself is slim, with a nice design and a small blue light to show it's plugged in. Overall a good purchase that does what it promises. Hopefully it will last too, although they give you a lifetime warranty of something happens.
customer_reviews.author: Michalis

customer_reviews.title: THis device gets really hot and drains way too much battery
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done but... Bought this dongle to be the solution connecting usb, ethernet and SD cards. But this device gets way too hot, especially when charging mac through the dongle. The temperature really concerns me. can't leave the dongle connected and leave the room, too afraid of fire hazard. SD cards write speed seems a little too slow, but not confirmed, it's just a feeling. I'm kinda disappointed after reading so many good reviews about it.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Great Hub for MacBook Pro 13" 2017
customer_reviews.text: I use this USB-C to connect my USB3 devices to my MacBook Pro that only has Thunderbolt 3 ports. It is a great hub for the price and you don't need an extra power supply for the hub. It uses the MacBook charger to power the hub and do power pass-thru. Definitely recommend for MacBook Pro 13" 2017. Plug and play with High Sierra.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I've used all inputs except the mini sd.
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for all my inputs at work including multiple USB ports, HDMI, Ethernet, and SD card. They all work great! It does get pretty hot when you've got it plugged in, but the color matches my space gray MacBook Pro pretty well, and I haven't had any issues with it working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: bboss182

customer_reviews.title: A great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this product for my company since November 2017. I get about 1 or 2 a week, so about 100 since, give or take. In all that time I only had 2 issues with failing units, on one the USB 3.0 port wasn't working and on the other the Ethernet port wasn't. I contacted the vendor and they replaced them right away with no hassle. I really like their products and their price is just one of the best. I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bahamaca - PMC

customer_reviews.title: Sleek looking and very compact USB Hub with many functions
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months with my 2017 Macbook Pro. Worked great overall -- does not overheat like some of the other USB C Hubs. Ethernet, HDMI, power, USB keyboard plugged in all through this one device. Recently noticed the ethernet stopped working. Sinstar offered to replace with lifetime guarantee however.
customer_reviews.author: gotdis55

customer_reviews.title: HDMI port does not work some times.
customer_reviews.text: Many times the HDMI port does not work when try to connect MacBook Pro to a HDMI port of a tv monitor or projector. I have seen this issue with many units we have among friends and colleagues. Replaced the unit twice and still seeing the issue. Looks like it is design issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anil

customer_reviews.title: It's a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: But that should've been obvious from the pictures. Wired network port worked at 1Gbps without any hassle. USB ports work fine. Haven't tried any of the other ports yet. Edit: The screen on my daughter's Macbook pro died so we got a chance to try the HDMI port. Works great! Bought a second one. My daughter won't let go of the one I loaned her.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Q

customer_reviews.title: Great hub for MacBook Pro Touchbar
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work daily... it's fantastic and totally recommended as the one stop shop for your MacBook Pro 15" touchbar on the road. The only thing it didn't have was a VGA out which my customer's still have in their conference rooms.
customer_reviews.author: jasond

customer_reviews.title: I have used this product as a hub for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product as a hub for my laptop. My laptop does not charge through the thunderbolt port so I can't comment about that, but everything on the unit is functional and it just works. It is very sleek and does exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: D. Worden

customer_reviews.title: Only works sometimes
customer_reviews.text: More often when you plug this into a Macbook it is not recognized. The fact that it only works intermittently means I basically never use it. Also didn't see consistent recognition of monitor even when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: bugle

customer_reviews.title: All ports and functions work well with my HP Spectre
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my HP Spectre x360. All of the ports and functions work as they should. Good device for the money.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months...
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product. Bought it for my MacBook Air. Worked for 6 months. Now it is not working. Not good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly G. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: *Careful* May Not Be Gigabit Ethernet Capable for Macs
customer_reviews.text: Hub works fine, does get warm but all of them do. Has lasted for a year so far. Only issue I have is that on the ethernet port, it is only Fast Ethernet capable, not gigabit. My office recently upgraded to a gigabit network and internet, and the hub is a bottleneck on my MacBook Pro 2017. Tested at home with my iMac 5k 2017, same results. Won't push past 92/94Mbps. Disappointed on that end. Customer Service is quick to respond. Test from images are from my home, where I get usually around 115/120 mbps down.
customer_reviews.author: Antony V. López

customer_reviews.title: Works great but two negatives
customer_reviews.text: Works great but two negatives: 1) gets hot and I'm worried it might cause damage. 2) scratches really easily. So if you keep this in a bag, it will look scratched and dinged very quickly. Other than that it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: SirZed

customer_reviews.title: This works very well and allows me to attach a ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well and allows me to attach a multitude of devices and connectors. The only caveat is that it gets very hot during use and I am not sure what the long term issues will be with the temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Henry MD

customer_reviews.title: Great Dongle for Wacom MSP and Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Great for all in one dongle that makes your life easier than caring 5 to 6 dongles, I use it with my Wacom MSP and it's keep my computer clean, simple when it comes to plugin HDMI, USBA, Ethernet, SD cards.....etc. Also, I had to mention a very good customer service experience. I only wish if it's had a mini display port.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It's ridiculous that you need something like this goofy thing just to connect to common devices, but that's Apple for you.
customer_reviews.author: jmv

customer_reviews.title: necessary purchase
customer_reviews.text: functionality is perfect and aesthetics look a lot better in person than in the picture. the ports seem to perform at good speeds. the only reason i can't rate it all 5 stars is because i think it would be more convenient if the main ports were located on the other side (outside) of the hub instead of the inside of the hub (as you can see in the picture). otherwise, i am happy i made this purchase so far and i think i will use this for as long as it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Had High Hopes - but there's a glimmer of hope.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hub in February of 2018. Worked fine for about 4 months. Ports started failing - first Hdmi then Usbs - until now - finally - it doesn't even pass through power to my laptop. Hub is completely broken and useless. Turns out the company has volunteered to provide a replacement so that's actually great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff&Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Design, Good Price and Super Functionality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 and received both units in good condition. Tested them in my HP Elite X360 1030 G2 and both units work very well. PD function, HDMI, SD card, Micro SD card USB 3 ports, all work fine with above lap top. Have not yet tested RJ45 port. I mainly chose it for the beautiful shape of the device and very good reviews. Up to now I am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nishan Mahanama

customer_reviews.title: HDMI connection is problematic
customer_reviews.text: I like what this product promises - however, since the beginning, its HDMI connection has always worked intermittently - you'd need to try plugging in the monitor a couple of times to make it work. Today, it has stopped altogether. Unfortunately, the return window (30 days) has passed - so I will need to re-purchase a replacement. It will not be this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Multiple USB 3.1 ports, ethernet port, usb-c port. Only con is it heats up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Eldo

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: One thing to note is that there are times when I have a hard drive plugged into one or two of the USB ports, and the SD card reader fails to work. A quick restart of my computer, or a simple unplug or unplugging of the device will do the trick, but of course when I am working, that can be a bit inconvenient. Overall, I do like this product and it does exactly what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Keanu Banayat

customer_reviews.title: Better than the ones that snap on
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dongle hands down. The other ones that snap onto your computer nay look nice but I’ve had a lot of problems with them. this one has all the same functions and works just great. !!!
customer_reviews.author: soochul myung

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Was offered a free replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Was offered a free replacement after contacting the seller. Great customer service! Previous: I gave many presentations because of this hub. Worked and looked great until all the USB ports stopped working. I can't contact the seller for warranty either.
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa Quadir

customer_reviews.title: Good product and useful
customer_reviews.text: Good product and fast responding ... make sure your MacBook 12 inches 2017 compatibility. The seller was very much communicative & effectively in touch.
customer_reviews.author: Hussam A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different USB C Hub from another company because it was a $20 or so cheaper, but it didn't work. So returned it and caved to pay for this one. It has worked great, and I've recommended it to friends with new Macs. I also mistakenly bought 2, and returned the 2nd one. The customer service experience for that was pleasant and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Palumbos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mini dock.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says, speeds and connections are fully functional. Thunderbolt 3 is incredible. I use it with the new Asus Zenbook Pro. It does run a little warm. Perfect for on the road travel. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Power pass through does give popup that I am not using an OEM charger but charges just fine on my device anyway
customer_reviews.text: Got this hub for use with a 13'" HP spectre x360. Solid device, with all ports functioning properly and not issues at all. Power pass through does give popup that I am not using an OEM charger but charges just fine on my device anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Denham

customer_reviews.title: It has worked for years.
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked for awhile with no issues. My only complaint is the USB ports are a little crowded. I had to specifically shop for flash drives that had no additional width.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerjgs

customer_reviews.title: Great adapter
customer_reviews.text: I've had this adapter for about 1.5 years and have used pretty much every port on it. Recently the cable that connects it to the computer became flaky likely from all the use. Seller is sending me a new one! Can't beat that kind of customer care!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's HOT! 105 degrees sitting on my desk. But it works
customer_reviews.text: Works great. But be careful because it runs crazy hot! It 105 Degrees on my desk where the room is only 75. I only have the ethernet plugged into it right now. Not sure if it will get hotter if I plug other stuff in too.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Dan

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet connection broke after 10 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: Was working great, but today the ethernet adapter decided to stop working (2 months after I bought it). My MacBook Pro won't even recognize the ethernet connection anymore in network settings. Not sure what happened. Frustrating, as this wasn't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Palotay

product_meta.title: USB C Hub, Sinstar 8 in 1 Aluminum Multi Port Adapter Type C Combo Hub for MacBook Pro USB C Hub to HDMI Male (4K) Type-C Pass Through, Ethernet, SD/Micro Card Reader and 3 USB 3.0 Ports (Space Gray)
product_meta.description:
Color:Space Gray
Product Features:
1.More Ports, More Convenience - features three USB 3.0 ports, SD and Micro SD card slots, Ethernet, charging port, and 4K HDMI video output.
2.High Transfer Rate - This HUB supports the maximum bandwidth of 5Gbps, transfer data and stream movies from your external storage devices, and no drivers are required.
3.HDMI 4k Video Display - Use the HDMI port to output crisp, high-resolution video to your 4k monitor screens. Simply, connect an HDMI cable from the Pro Hub Adapter to your external monitor to view crystal-clear display.
4. Durable & Compact Design - brushed aluminum design compliments Apple accessories, it simple to take the Type-C USB Hub with you anywhere you go.
5. Easy to use - does not require any software, drivers, or complicated installation process, can support Mac OS 9.1 and above Windows XP/Vista/7/8/10 Linux.

Compatibility List:

Full compatible with these devices(Both Data Transfer And Charge)
1)Macbook 2015/Macbook 2016
2)Macbook Pro 13''/15''2016
3) Google Chromebook 2016
4)Microsoft Lumia 950/950XL
5)Hua Wei Matebook 2016 !!!An extra 60W power plug needed for power delivery to work
6)Dell XPS 13/15 An extra 60W power plug needed for power delivery to work
7)Xiaomi Air 2016 12.5”
8)HP Spectre Notebook 2016 13”

Data Transfer Works But CANNOT pass power to these devices
1)Asus ZenBook3/Transformer3 Pro
2)Samsung TabPro S
3)Wacom mobilestudio pro 16
4) Nexus 6P

Specifications:
* Supports USB3.1 USB-C (Type-C 1.0 Spec)
* Supports PD charging via USB-C
* Supports 3xUSB 3.0 Hub 
* Supports Internet 1000M LAN
* Supports SD and micro SD (UHS-I) to use at the same time
* LED indicate for working status
* Hot plug & play, driverless
* Color: Silver, Grey, Gold
feature_bullets: 8-in-1 Multi Ports Design, Expand Your Type-C Port-- Features three USB 3.0 ports, SD and Micro SD card slots, Ethernet, charging port, and 4K HDMI video output. Note: Use HDMI 2.0 Cables for Optimum Performance
Support New Type-C products-- Including new 12" MacBook, MacBook Pro 13" and MacBook Pro 15" 2018,Google Pixel Chromebook, ASUS Zenbook 3 (UX390), Dell XPS 13, 2016 HP Spectre, Surface 4 pro
Fast Speed Data Transmission-- USB version 3.0, offers data transmission speed up to 5 Gbps, you can transfer everything from a 2TB SD card to your MacBook in just a few seconds

Slim & Compact, Easy to Carry- The compact and easy-to-use design makes it simple to take the Type-C USB Hub with you anywhere you go, you won't be far from the convenience of accessing your favorite USB devices

One Year Guarantee-- We provide 1 Year Guarantee for this product, if you have any problem or unsatisfied with your order, you can contact us at any time, we will help to cancel the order or refund your money at any time

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars412 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
